I don't know if this is related to the bug but I am seeing 2 "Build All" 
actions on the menu.

Adding NE to the CC list. Does this look related to the other "2 build icon"
problems that you have seen?

Marcelo, which VM are you using?

I don't think this is related to the button problem for two reasons:
1. He says it occurred in I20030304.  The button problem was only introduced in 
I20030307.
2. This is in the build.  The button does not listen to builds.

It may even be in the builder at this point.  Hard to tell due to the missing 
stack frame.

What kind of project does this occur in?  Do you know what builders are 
installed (look at the .project file).

I have 8 java projects.  2 of them are using the 
org.eclipse.emf.codegen.JETBuilder.

I've just tested the driver without the EMF plugins and everything seems to be 
OK.  After adding the EMF again (latest version of plugins and feature) I was 
asked to do an update and to restart eclipse.  After restarting it, I've got 
the exceptions pasted below during the eclipse startup.

It seems that the problem is related to the addition of the EMF builder - 
although the stack trace is not presenting any *.emf.* class.

Since this bug only appears when the EMF builder is installed, and since the
missing stack frames in the stack trace look like they belong to the client
code, this looks like a problem with the EMF builder.  I'm going to move the bug
report over to EMF so they can investigate further.

The latest stack shown by Marcelo does not have any missing frames; the top 
stack frame is in the BuildManager:

java.lang.NullPointerException at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$2.run(BuildManager.java:427)

I cannot reproduce this problem in the RC1 driver which has this code at line 
427:

        public void run() throws Exception {
            IProject[] builders = currentBuilder.build(trigger, args, monitor);
            if (builders == null)
                builders = new IProject[0];
            currentBuilder.setInterestingProjects((IProject[]) 
builders.clone());  // <---- this is 427
        }

Neither currentBuilder nor builders could conceivably be null at this point, so 
it's not surprising that I can't reproduce a problem.

Since I can't reproduce a problem and since it's not occurring in the EMF 
builder, I think this needs further investigation in the platform code.  My 
suspicion is that since our builder returns null, it's that return value that 
isn't being handled properly in the by the BuildManager , although the code 
above shows that it is handled okay (and that is impossible for there to be a 
null point exception at that line).   By the way, it seems pretty odd to clone 
an empty array that was just allocated.

We've seen several JIT bugs causing NPEs in the IBM 1.3.1 VMs (SR1, SR2 and 
SR3, although they sometimes behave differently on particular cases).
If you have a reproduceable case, could you please try using some other VMs, or 
running with the JIT off (add "-vmargs -Djava.compiler=none" to the end of your 
eclipse command line).

Marking as a VM JIT problem.
Please re-open if you have a reproducible case on a different VM or with JIT 
disabled.
Thanks.
